Text: RT @dotcomplicated: Miss today's show with ‘YouTuber of the Year,’ @CaseyNeistat? Get the Radio Recap here! https://t.co/m2vcUCEI8S
Thanks for tuning in for today's show on "Authentic Marketing" - special thanks to @CaseyNeistat Director/Vlogger on YouTube!
"You can find me on YouTube." @CaseyNeistat
"I love SnapChat, Twitter, & Instagram."@CaseyNeistat
"We're about the do a huge launch for @bemeapp, that's the main focus right now." @CaseyNeistat
"My favorite camera is my cell phone." @CaseyNeistat
"My proudest moment is seeing my kids born." @CaseyNeistat
"We've all seen the cluttered mess in your office. How are you able to think straight and create from there?" -Caller Debbie
"I created @bemeapp because I wanted a platform to share video without self-consciousness. It's a way to share honestly." @CaseyNeistat
Yes, absolutely @caviness! https://t.co/Eq1rJUBS16
"I have friends who do daily vlogs that shoot and edit directly from their cell phones. That's amazing!" @CaseyNeistat
"I take it very seriously, I don't mess around. I love every second and my typical edits take 3-6 hours in post production." @CaseyNeistat
"I love making videos more than anything. When you're churning out sheer quantity there's no time to dwell. You just post." @CaseyNeistat
"People shouldn't look outward because it makes you a follower. Whatever you're deciding you should look inward." @CaseyNeistat
"What's more exciting to me is looking at the future of media like Netflix, festivals, Amazon. Those are really interesting." @CaseyNeistat
"Would you ever go back to a traditional cable network to do a docu-series?"  -Caller James
"Nike is great because of their willingness to take chances. I had a deal to make 3 videos. I took a risk for the 3rd one." @CaseyNeistat
We want to hear from YOU! Do you have questions or comments for @CaseyNeistat? Call us live at 1-844-WHARTON or tweet @dotcomplicated!
"I made a short video about bike lanes in a funny way, but it was a relevant issue. It led me to other PSA's." @CaseyNeistat
"YouTube is the ultimate place to succeed. There's no nepotism, no hierarchy. If people want to see your stuff, they will." @CaseyNeistat
Sounds amazing @RTFarrell! https://t.co/OT5uz9G8VQ
"One of my dreams has been to make film making democratic. Now all you need is a cell phone." @CaseyNeistat

Thank you for calling in @hangarcat! https://t.co/vdVBv3Q62q
"It was really great working with my brother, he's a pure artist. He follows his instinct and he's inspiring." @CaseyNeistat
"I credit my older brother with getting me into film making. We ended up having an HBO series 10 yrs later." @CaseyNeistat
"I don't think you know what life is until you work in a restaurant." @CaseyNeistat
"I fell in love with film making immediately. I've realized how elusive it is to find something your that passionate about." @CaseyNeistat
"I'm 1 of 4 kids. I ran away from home at 15 & had a baby at 17. I got a job as a dishwasher. It was a tumultuous start." @CaseyNeistat
"How do you find the balance between being authentic on the internet and protecting  your identity and your family?" -caller Sebastian
"The line is hard to define between what you share & don't share. I lightly skim off the top of my actual life." @CaseyNeistat
"If there's something I want to do, I make it my mission to do it. I fantasize about being healthy until I die an old man." @CaseyNeistat
"What is at the top of your bucket list?" -caller Kyle

Thanks for tuning in for today's show -special thanks to @missmayim creator of @GrokNation!
"@GrokNation is literally something I could work on all day. It's my main project. It's me and 2 other mighty women." @missmayim
"The causes I support often come to me and it's difficult to choose what to support. I decide by what speaks to me." @missmayim @GrokNation
"I think one of the most important things for young girls is to hear from women who are in STEM. They are creative fields." @missmayim
"I have enough health to surround myself with people who believe in me more than I believe in myself. They help me dream big." @missmayim
"It's a really difficult thing, it's something I'm still trying to figure out myself." @missmayim
"Where do you think gene studies are going with genetic information?"- caller Adrienne
"I was on Blossom from 14-19 yrs old and I fell in love with Science. I went to UCLA and studied neuroscience and I got my Phd." @missmayim
App 5: Insight Timer is a meditation app. There's a library of guided meditations by time.
App 4: Face Bomb & Face Plant. You can switch faces in photos and these apps make me laugh. They're hours of fun!
App 3: World's Brightest Flash Light - this was one of my first apps.
App 2: https://t.co/EULbx6wHzI is a website where you can look up any movie. It gives you details about subjects that might be sensitive.
App 1: HabitRPG is a motivational program where you set tasks for yourself. You can check them off during the day.
Ha! So true @krewmom! https://t.co/sPCXEmoY5V
"Jewish modesty taught me that I get to set boundaries about my own body. It feels empowering as a feminist to me." @missmayim @GrokNation
Have questions for @missmayim call us at 1-844-WHARTON or tweet @dotcomplicated!
"When it comes to being Modern Orthodox I call myself observant-ish. I do my best to work around holidays & I'm transparent." @missmayim
"I've never done theater because the hours are not compatible with being a parent. Sitcom hours are great for being a parent." @missmayim
"I wrote about living the attachment parenting lifestyle in our home. My main job in life is to be a parent." @missmayim
"I'm a lot of things at once and there's no rules about what I can do. I was raised to speak my mind." @missmayim
"We all have a responsibility as human beings to make the world better. In small ways and big ways." @missmayim @GrokNation
"The Bill Cosby post made me nervous, but I wanted to look at it in a way that was not gossipy. What's the bigger message?" @missmayim
"We wanted to write about the small charities that change lives. We eventually want to have our own charity foundation." @missmayim
"How can we harness social media to transmit information. I wanted to incorporate a charity component." @missmayim
"I was writing items of pop culture that people don't usually talk about. Like why is Ariana G. on a billboard in her underwear." @missmayim

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on "Bitcoin & Digital Currency" - special thanks to @mikejcasey, @paulvigna & @3DContentBlog!
"Start thinking about, 'what is the money in your wallet?' What does it represent. We need to investigate for ourselves." @paulvigna
"Take Bitcoin seriously. It has created an enormous opportunity to de-centralize the global economy. It's profound." @mikejcasey
"The main point is that this documentary is for people who don't understand Bitcoin. It needs to be taken more seriously." @3DContentBlog
"I don't think Bitcoin will replace other currencies, but I think it's a good alternative. It will bring competitive pressure." @paulvigna
"Bitcoin let's you be in control of your money, that's powerful. People in Greece can't get into their own bank accounts." @3DContentBlog
"Could the problem in Greece be fixed with Bitcoin, yes. I don't think it will be because it's too new." @3DContentBlog
"Once various suppliers are all tied into Bitcoin, you can track each others payments & deliveries. That's a powerful aspect." @mikejcasey
"I wouldn't use it as the sole currency, but you can brand yourself as a site that uses Bitcoin." @paulvigna
"I work for a tech start up for an e-commerce site. What are the pros of using Bitcoin as a sole form of currency?" Caller Jocelyn
"Bitcoin can achieve a whole lot of things. For example property titles could be confirmed & we wouldn't need title ensurers." @mikejcasey
"Bitcoin is happening in the real world. It's part of a larger shift in the global economy. It's an interesting story." @paulvigna
"Do you see micro-payments as replacing things like ads?" Caller Michael
"It's hard to make small payments with a credit card because there are fees, but Bitcoin doesn't care how small the payment is." @mikejcasey
"I approached the project like a start-up. We did a kickstarter and the rest is self-funded. Having a fan base motivated us." @3DContentBlog
"Bitcoin is such a complicated topic that most people can't easily understand it. It's the perfect topic for a documentary." @3DContentBlog
Questions or comments for our guests about digital currency or Bitcoin? Tweet us at @dotcomplicated!
"We've had massive online attacks happen all over. Powerful encryption needs to be in place. The ledger itself can't be hacked." @mikejcasey
"2013 was the first time I heard about it & I thought it was a scam, but then my curiosity was piqued." @paulvigna #TheAgeofCryptocurrency
"I received a call that multiple instances were being opened on my online site. I found out it was likely Bitcoin miners." Caller Roger
"In theory there will be fewer Bitcoins produced each year. So paper money will decrease in value and Bitcoin will increase." @TheEndOfMoney
"The use cases for Bitcoin are going to explode so the price will rise. That's why a lot of people are investing in Bitcoin." @paulvigna
"You could offer a service or you could mine Bitcoin if you already had a lot of money." @mikejcasey
"Can I make money by investing in Bitcoin." Caller Gerald
"You're much more traced in a bitcoin world than a cash world." @mikejcasey
"For your bitcoin account your identity is encrypted, but authorities can still track who you are." @paulvigna
Do you use Bitcoin? Do you prefer digital currency? Let us know by tweeting @dotcomplicated!
"Bitcoin isn't encouraging you to do illegal activities, but it does make it easier."  @paulvigna
"How do you reconcile online anonymity because it can be used for illegal activities?" Caller Jason
"Bitcoin is a ledger, a record of transactions that resides on multiple computers. We can make a transfer & know it's not fake." @mikejcasey
"He's finally woken up, so I like this." @mikejcasey
Like or Dislike? Russian President Putin admitted he was open to using digital currency in his country.
Like or Dislike? The first 5 star robot hotel opened for business in Japan. It features humanoid robots at the reception desk.
Like or Dislike? A new urban dictionary for Silicon Valley jargon is out. Is this helpful?

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on "Finance/career tips for women" -special thanks to @NicoleLapin author of #RichBitch!
“People can find me at https://t.co/wHQ585HAld and @NicoleLapin on Twitter.” @NicoleLapin
“My favorite apps are Instagram and Uber.” @NicoleLapin
“Women in general go through a lot of different stages. The book is a guide & financial terms are defined in the back.” @NicoleLapin
“Women talk about everything, but money. Talking about what we make can give you empowerment to get what you deserve.” @NicoleLapin
“#RichBitch is a 12 step program to get your financial life together. The first step is admitting you have a problem.” @NicoleLapin
“There’s a difference between doing something on the side that’s a passion, and just hustling to make money.” @NicoleLapin #RichBitch
“I think of an accountant like a personal trainer. They give you the moves, but then you can implement it on your own.” @NicoleLapin
“You create a budget. If taking clients to lunch is in the budget, then you aren’t sneaking, but if not, you’re messing it up.” @NicoleLapen
“Make a 1, 3, 5, 7 and 10 year plan and focus on those goals at that time. Create a cohesive narrative for yourself.” @NicoleLapin
“It’s important to become the CEO of you. Treat your life like a business.” @NicoleLapin
“Get your financial life together in bite size pieces that aren’t overwhelming. Don’t bite off more than you can chew.” @NicoleLapin
“I thought I needed to network with men on a golf course, but I realized I didn’t need to play golf to network.” @NicoleLapin
“I think that having a maternal instinct in business is important because you want to have people who want to work with you.” @NicoleLapin
“I don’t want to be considered a woman doing well in a man’s world. I want to be a general badass.” @NicoleLapin #RichBitch
“If I won the lottery I’d be doing exactly the same thing I’m doing. When bad things happen, you appreciate the good things.” @NicoleLapin
“I’m a girl’s girl, but in this case I don’t feel bad for her. What she was complaining about doesn’t seem valid enough.” @NicoleLapin
An employee at Yelp wrote an open letter to the CEO outlining her struggles. Was it appropriate? Tweet @dotcomplicated or call 1-844-WHARTON
“It’s important to discuss whose name is on everything. Is there a will? Is there life insurance? Things happen.” @NicoleLapin
“I’m a believer in secret accounts for women. You never know what could happen.” @NicoleLapin
“I wouldn’t discuss FICO score on the first date, but it’s like the STD conversation, it’s awkward but necessary.” @NicoleLapin
When do you disclose to the person you’re dating that you’re financially successful? Tweet us at @dotcomplicated!
“Women are intimidated & don’t know what to ask for. An overall compensation package is important when negotiating salary.” @NicoleLapin
“I realized that a man who had less responsibilities was making more because he went in and asked for more money.” @NicoleLapin
“I was offered a job by a female boss & I was willing to take less money to hopefully be mentored. So I didn’t ask for more.” @NicoleLapin
“Negotiating salary is important. My first job my salary was 20K. I kept going, kept hustling & worked my way up.” @NicoleLapin
“Money touches all aspects of our lives.  Allowance, household, with your partner, crisis, death etc. It can be scary.” @NicoleLapin
“You could go to Japan & not know the language & get around ok, but you’ll be confused. Money is a language.” @NicoleLapin #RichBitch
“I did a study on the streets. I would ask women what they make. They would rather tell me their weight than what they made.” @NicoleLapin
“Budgeting sucks, but so does being broke.” @NicoleLapin #RichBitch
"I was on Bloomberg and I realized I wasn't reaching the audience that needed it most." @NicoleLapin
“You’re starting a business, and that’s good, but you’re going to miss the bottom line.” @NicoleLapin
“Starting a business out of donating, that’s not a business. That’s a passion. It’s a charity. They’re a business first.” @NicoleLapin

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on "Women in Business/The Imposter Syndrome" - special thanks to @TamaraMcCleary & @bookstothesky!
"You can find me at https://t.co/mEUe15R4GF and on twitter @TamaraMcCleary, I'm all about connecting."
"People can check me out at https://t.co/KtFpFTXLTr and on twitter @bookstothesky"
"My #1 tip is stop diminishing yourself so others can feel better. Our highest service is living to our fullest potential." @TamaraMcCleary
"Women need somewhere supportive to go where they can talk about their success. Find successful women who own their success." @bookstothesky
"We judge other women who own their success. We need to applaud those women and support each other." @TamaraMcCleary
"I suggest that women who are interviewing look at the organization to see if women are in leadership positions." @TamaraMcCleary
"If you want to be acknowledged as a leader, you have to own that success. Be comfortable in it and do not apologize." @bookstothesky
"I may not feel confident, but I know that I'm not meant to stay in that place. you have to know what you want." @TamaraMcCleary
"As a publishing partner I'm looking to build a business & use the book as a tool. It becomes a tool of content marketing." @bookstothesky
"So many women suffer guilt by trying to squeeze into an out-dated model. The way out is to remember those are feelings." @TamaraMcCleary
"A lot of people write and lecture, but when you read a book that's focused on the reader that's a different experience." @bookstothesky
"We don't need to look for love and appreciation. Our ministry is to love. Servant leadership is what influences." @TamaraMcCleary
"When we look for evidence that we're loved we don't put ourselves out there. We need to think about making a difference." @TamaraMcCleary
"When you look at personal brand, my experience is even great women executives can be disastrous creating their own brand. @TamaraMcCleary
"When we see good business books written by women it changes our culture and gives us models to aspire to." @bookstothesky
"J.K. Rowling famously used her initials to appeal to boys, it's hard to build a brand if you don't use your name." @bookstothesky
RT @TamaraMcCleary: "So many #women are on the top of their game...and they feel almost permanently guilty." ~ @bookstothesky #womenintech …

"There is that little voice in your head that says don't brag, don't be a show off. Women don't want to be disliked." @bookstothesky
"What are you doing in your 24 hour day to feel a sense of wholeness and to create a sense of empowerment?" @TamaraMcCleary
"The dissatisfaction comes when we feel out of alignment with what we place our 'shoulds' on. We have to shift out of that." @TamaraMcCleary
"We have to look at the fact that life can never be balanced in the modern world. We need to look for a life of wholeness." @TamaraMcCleary
"A woman submitted her book and got a lukewarm response & then under a male pseudonym and she got an enthusiastic response." @bookstothesky
"Generally I hear from women this limiting belief of 'who am I to write this book?' I've never heard that from a man." @bookstothesky

"Go to https://t.co/NhojAkir5X and check it out the next time you need a workout." @sarahkunst @prodayco
"We are building a platform for humans + AI. We want to empower people to use AI everyday. Things like UBER & twitter." @mikhailnaumov
"Calendar apps are kind of rude. They help the person, but they don't know how to be polite. That's a hard thing to teach an AI." @sarakunst
"I think AI is going to be more helpful than harmful. It's invisible right now, like GPS. I think it's too early to worry about." @duyhtq
"Very smart people are focusing on the ethics of AI. It can evolve beyond it's purpose. The ethical question is complicated." @MikhailNaumov
"As technology becomes more intelligent it becomes more invisible. I think robots will become more invisible." @MikhailNaumov
"AI will take care of repetitive work, but those workers are counting on those jobs. We don't know how it will affect them." @sarakunst
"For inventory count an AI will be more accurate and it will allow the sales team to sell more." @duyhtq @autonomousdotai
"In the short term there are millions that work in a call center, but they will have new potential to unlock new skills." @MikhailNaumov
Are people going to be replaced by robots in their jobs? Do people need to learn new skills?
"Not many of us know how to ride a horse. Some skills become less relevant. With cars maybe we'll have less accidents." @mikhailnaumov

"Any tech that can be used to help people, I'm all about it. I love how tech is moving to really useful things." @TheDroneGirl

Big thank you to our guests @DrYaldaUhls and @cc_chapman for discussing #DigitalAgeParenting with us! See you next week on @dotcomplicated!
"It's way easier to ignore people with books than it is devices."- @DrYaldaUhls
"When you're finished, make it finished. Let your kids know you have put the device away and are focused on them."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Even just taking a few minutes without screens is a way to show your kids that you're there and that it's family time."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Being able to communicate with a screen is sometimes a beautiful thing."- @DrYaldaUhls
"When you go to the App store, it may show an app as 'educational' but that's really just the developer labeling it so."- @DrYaldaUhls
"We need games for girls that they love. When girls learn, when boys learn, we all learn."- @DrYaldaUhls
"We don't have a culture that allows girls to be comfortable playing these games."- @DrYaldaUhls
"They did an experiment with girls who play video games, and saw a rise in spacial learning in girls in relation to STEM."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Video games actually help with spacial learning. People who score high in spacial learning are shown to do well in STEM."- @DrYaldaUhls
"As digital immigrants we don't always notice, but technology is ingrained in our lives at every turn."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Kids who did not have devices at camp for 5 days showed improvements in picking up emotional & social ques."-@DrYaldaUhls
"We did a traditional camp, but it was a device free zone for 5 days."- @DrYaldaUhls
"I'm also surprised by the average age of gamers- 35 year old females."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Mobile changed everything. I was surprised that the iPhone was introduced in 2007. It hasn't been around for even 10 years."- @DrYaldaUhls
App 5: "@GoGeocaching is like a digital treasure hunt. When you're on vacation it's fun & gets you doing things together."- @cc_chapman
App 4: "@timehop goes through your feed and looks back at what you did 1 year, 2 years etc. ago at what you did on that day."-@cc_chapman
App 3: "@Snapchat is great because as a parent you are able to be involved in what your kids are doing & sharing."-@cc_chapman #DigitalDads
App 2: "#Bring is an app where anyone in your family can add to a list. It keeps us sane when creating our shopping list."-@cc_chapman
App 1: "@TripIt for managing all my travel arrangements, & my family can see my calendar and know where I am at any given time."-@cc_chapman

"Children watch you drive. As young as 5 they are learning to drive by watching you."-@DrYaldaUhls
"The biggest influence on the number of hours children watch TV is the amount of TV their parents are watching."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Tech is always changing. It's more important to keep communication open with kids than it is to learn every app they're on."- @DrYaldaUhls
"We aren't helicopter parents. In this day and age, we're 'drone parents'"-@DrYaldaUhls
"Kids are using technology for what it's intended for. They need these skills. If they don't know, they won't be prepared."- @DrYaldaUhls
"Media always jumps on the scariest story. I felt like the books that were out there were based on parent's fears."-@DrYaldaUhls

Thanks for tuning in to today's show on Travel Apps- special thanks to guests Jared Kons of the Bug Spray App, and AJ McGowan of @dufl!
"I'm an app hoarder. Not useful, taking space, I don't care. I like having it there just in case."-AJ McGowan @dufl
"I had this particular app I deleted that was draining my battery. I don't delete many apps unless it's causing a problem."-Jared Kons
"I use restaurant apps a lot. I like knowing what the best restaurants are when I'm traveling."-Jared Kons, Bug Spray App
"I'm definitely a user of @lyft and @hotelstonight." -AJ McGowan @dufl
"I'm interested in all the bio metric sensing. Things like the Apple Watch. I think it will be strange at first, but exciting."-Jared Kons
"I think the entire App enabled movement is virtualizing all these things that used to be a manual process."-AJ McGowan @dufl
"Our workers are very familiar with handling goods and property. We're definitely set up to deal with people's items."-AJ McGowan @dufl
"For hotels the most important is business travelers. Getting them back in their hotels is the name of the game."-AJ McGowan @dufl
"Even if it's just from a defense perspective. Protect your ideas. I encourage any entrepreneur to go forward with it."-AJ McGowan @dufl
"Patents need to be novel. Unique. And I recommend looking into patenting your ideas. It's very powerful for your business."-Jared Kons
"People tell their friends, & as your ranking goes up in App stores, it snowballs with people downloading."-Jared Kons, Bug Spray App
"If I had to do it again I'd be interested in patenting my idea and trade mark my ideas. I didn't really do that"-Jared Kons, Bug Spray App
"Entrepreneurship is exciting & nerve wracking. In the first weeks of @dufl we were focused on logistics. That was a challenge."-AJ McGowan

Thanks for tuning in! Special thanks @mikejcasey, @paulvigna of The Age of Cryptocurrency, and Torsten Hoffmann of @TheEndOfMoney!
"Even if you don't become a Bitcoin believer, I at least hope you'll start wondering what is the money in your wallet?"-@paulvigna
"There's a lot of pent up trust in that system. I don't think it will go away. The appeal with Bitcoin is all you can do."-@mikejcasey
"Look at the people in Greece, government is control of their finances. Having control of your finances is very powerful."-Torsten Hoffman
"As a merchant you pay 3% for credit card transactions. With Bitcoin it's down to 1%, and that adds up after awhile."-@mikejcasey
"In places where you have underdeveloped democracies, you can start to build a large collateral. It's very powerful."-@mikejcasey
"The thing that jumps out to me is where Bitcoin connects with large faucets in the economy. It's not happening in a vacuum."-@paulvigna
"Bitcoin you can make as small as you want, and the system doesn't really care. You can create a whole different media model."-@mikejcasey
"First, you have to understand money, the problems, and how Bitcoin could be a solution."-Torsten Hoffman @TheEndOfMoney
Have any comments about Bitcoin and Digital Currency? Tweet @dotcomplicated or call 1-844-WHARTON.
"If a hacker has a sophisticated enough computer, they will get what they're looking for. There's no way around it."-@paulvigna
"You can't simultaneously hack thousands of computers at once. Remember that Bitcoin as a ledger is much more secure."-@mikejcasey
"People laugh it off. Then they start reading about it, blogs, books, films. The more you learn, the more fascinating."-Torsten Hoffmann
"The demand for the coins is going to rise. There is a case to be made for why bitcoin's prices will rise exponentially."-@mikejcasey
"You're much more traced in a bitcoin world than a cash world."-@mikejcasey
On anonymity- "Here's the trick- while your identity is encrypted, your transaction history is public." @paulvigna
"Bitcoin is a record of transactions that resides in multiple computers. We are able to transfer now digitally to a stranger."-@mikejcasey

Thanks for tuning in to today's show! Special thanks to guests Brian Fenty & Matt Baer of @TodayTix, & @braddgriffith of @GametimeUnited!
"I'm a huge fan of @lyft and @UberPools. In terms of deleting Apps- I haven't."-@braddgriffith @GametimeUnited
"I love the @nytimes App. If I have any down time, I always check to see what's going on."-Merritt Baer @TodayTix
"@Uber and @instagram are Apps that I use on a daily basis."-Brian Fenty @TodayTix
"If you're going to start a business, do it with your best friend. Had I done it alone I would have given up 100x already."-Merritt Baer
"We're never taking what's on a computer and shrinking it into a 4 inch screen. It's all mobile and unique."-Brian Fenty @TodayTix
"We display our prices and fees. It's upfront. Which builds a lot of trust as well."-Brian Fenty @TodayTix
"A lot of our trust comes from App Store reviews and our delivery method. Uniformed concierge who will have your tickets."-Merritt Baer
"92% of customers heard about us through a friend."-@braddgriffith @GametimeUnited

Do you think phones will replace computers entirely for purchasing tickets to shows and events?
"15min before a game starts is kind of the sweet spot. But we also have people who buy 20 days in advance. It varies."-@braddgriffith
"The tickets come from teams, fans, all entities, the prices change every 10 seconds and we show 50 of the best values."-@braddgriffith
"Any time you make it easier to transact an asset, you have happy business owners."-@braddgriffith @GametimeUnited
"What we did was build a product that we thought was interesting. We wanted to build something for mobile from the start."-@braddgriffith
"Working in sports you learn a ton about the business. From the team side to the business side."-@braddgriffith @GametimeUnited
"The ticket is mobile, a barcode on your phone, a paperless ticket."-@braddgriffith @GametimeUnited

Thanks for tuning into today's show! Special thanks to our guests Aparna Pande, @vikasgupta and @rananlachman!
"What we found was that the way we designed the robot- technology done right is more friendly for kids who are shy."-@vikasgupta
"It's amazing how kids have responded to the color and focus that playing with Legos brings."-@rananlachman
"When I started @Kidstir, my mom- an early interventionist, reminded me to keep all kids in mind."-Aparna Pande
"When their kid has a birthday we sent them a big box of Lego play. Something they can all have fun with."-@rananlachman
"I have a real problem with the way kids menus are made in the U.S. They're dumbed down."-Aparna Pande
"We started creating video, we have people who reach out to us often asking if we can facilitate a class."-Aparna Pande
"We want to create an experience that is fun for kids. But also that parents will want to do it again with their kids."-Aparna Pande
"A special cook book kit. 3 recipes and activities. A lot of fun teachings like cheeses from around the world."- Aparna Pande @Kidstir
"Influencing kids early is important. But it's hard to do and stay consistent. Beyond just baking sweets."- Aparna Pande @Kidstir
"Teaching your kids to cook makes them healthier. It starts with parents."-Aparna Pande @Kidstir
"I had to really be a vigilant parent about everything they were eating. I started reading labels for nuts, but got concerned."-Aparna Pande
"Top sets girls rent- Star Wars. Things that are seen as 'boys' sets."-@rananlachman
"We have a great relationship with Lego. We have a real connection with the consumer."-@rananlachman
"That's part of the benefit. You eliminate clutter, and the toys are re-used. There is a sustainability part of it."-@rananlachman
"We developed a very comprehensive technology company. We clean and sanitize, check all pieces, and send it to the next."-@rananlachman
"We make it really magical. You go to our website, and select from 100's of Lego sets. Like a playlist you can change it."-@rananlachman
"One day I realized I spent $3,000 on Legos for my son, they're great. But I realized there is a better way to do it."-@rananlachman

"I use a lot of P2P apps—@Uber, @TaskRabbit, @Airbnb." -@veelondono
"@veniamworks has turned cars into WiFi hotspots." -@rmchase
"Insurance companies are very risk adverse. It's difficult to get them to do anything innovative." -@rmchase of @bzzcr
"In France, there's one country and one set of rules—I was able to get the right insurance in a year." -@rmchase of @bzzcr
"We push the human element—there's no anonymity." -@krrbsale
"@Quirky is basically crowdsourcing for innovations." -@rmchase
"We are even sharing our personal networks on @LinkedIn." -@rmchase of @bzzcr
"With P2P, we started with our most expensive assets and are working down from there." -@rmchase of @bzzcr
"P2P is a new revenue stream for businesses." -@veelondono
"We see more and more businesses coming to @krrbsale to collaborate on the P2P economy." -@veelondono

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on difficult conversations. Special thanks to my guests @RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss & Douglas Stone.
"During a difficult conversation, it's okay to take a step back and regroup." -@RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss
"What people get really emotional about is things, not as much money." -@RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss
"We all think there is a rule that you have to finish a conversation." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"It's easy to interpret things differently when you communicate digitally." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"It's almost always better to have difficult conversations face-to-face with a person." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"It's important to keep the lines of communication open." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"The best time for feedback is right when something is happening." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"When I'm focused on my internal voice, it's easy to not hear what's being said in a real conversation." -Douglas Stone
"We have a conversation in our minds at the same time we are having a real conversation." -Douglas Stone of “Difficult Conversations"
"Difficult conversations have a great deal to do with how we see ourselves and who we are in the world." -Douglas Stone

"There wasn't really anything like bereavement leave. I really hope this changes." -@RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss
"There is something out there called resilience. It's okay to go through this and you're gonna be okay." -@RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss
"Overwhelmingly, this country in particular, we have this expectation that we should be over loss in 365 days." -@RebeccaSoffer @ModernLoss
"People don't like talking about loss. They don't like thinking about their own mortality." -@RebeccaSoffer of @ModernLoss

Thank you for tuning in for today's show on new books! Special thanks to my guests @joshuabraff @BrigidSchulte & @rude_jude!
"Done is better than perfect." –@BrigidSchulte on writing her book and dealing with perfectionism
"I write what I know. I only know how to write facts." –@rude_jude
"When you sign with a big publisher, it looks really good." –@rude_jude
"When I was self-publishing, I had a hard time getting into a book store." –@rude_jude
"My publisher saw the vision that I saw." –@BrigidSchulte on finding the right publisher
"I had no idea how to write a book, but I knew in the back of my head I really wanted to." –@BrigidSchulte
"We have to recapture the view that leisure time is valuable–that 'play' is good and needed." –@BrigidSchulte
"We have celebrated overworking and 'workaholism' in our society." –@BrigidSchulte
"We have to attack the work culture. We are human beings, not machines." -@BrigidSchulte
"My book is about the quest for leisure time." –@BrigidSchulte
"I was challenged to keep a diary of my time and discovered 27 hours of leisure time—but they were in bits and pieces." –@BrigidSchulte
"The Bureau of Labor Statistics has time-use researchers who look at how we spend our time." -@BrigidSchulte
Have questions/comments on writing a book? Tweet @dotcomplicated or call 1-844-WHARTON!
"I ended up selling the same book 6 times to the same person. They wanted the new editions." –@rude_jude
"I was 'top 300' on @amazon the whole time." –@rude_jude
"I would not release an e-book. It cheapens it. I don't want someone to 'swipe right' through my life." -@rude_jude
"I was worried some suit wasn't going to understand what I had to say. So I self-published." –@rude_jude
"Where I don't have education, I have life experience and I have a voice. You can learn voice, you earn it." –@rude_jude
"Authors get a lot of respect." –@rude_jude on wanting to write a book
"It's about childrearing from a male perspective, the love in a marriage, & growing into adulthood w/friends." @joshuabraff on his new book
"If you really have it in you, you need to find a space away from everything else." –@joshuabraff on advice to future writers
"All writers are observers of life." –@joshuabraff
"My new book 'The Daddy Diaries' is really relatable today. More dads are staying at home." –@joshuabraff
"My genre is human condition/literary fiction—a dad and son sitting on the porch on any given Tuesday." –@joshuabraff
"Some authors like the writing of the book, and others like the selling of the book. I like both." –@joshuabraff
Being a successful author takes much more than a brilliant manuscript. #UltimateEntrepreneur

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on branding! Special thanks to my guests @PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself & @heyitscb of @makesnaps
"You can only bury something if it's unique and isolated. You can't hide an actual bad reputation." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"You have to move quickly to be relevant in the age of digital." –@heyitscb of @makesnaps #onlinepresence
"Social media has helped brands learn they need to move quickly. You can't plan too far out." –@heyitscb of @makesnaps
"There's no thing as 'separation.' What is out there is out there." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself #onlinepresence
"Constraints can breed creativity, but can be challenging to overcome as well." -@heyitscb of @makesnaps
"@taylorswift13 was smart to buy her domains. Domains hold power." -@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"Engagement in messaging is going up, not down. It's best to establish presence early in that space." @heyitscb of @makesnaps
"As communication has gotten shorter, visuals take messaging into a more exciting place." -@heyitscb of @makesnaps
"Brands are able to create custom keyboards and put their business in a new space." @heyitscb of @makesnaps
"Millennials spend 2-3 hours a day messaging from their keyboards." –@heyitscb of @makesnaps
"Consumers have moved into more fragmented messages." —@heyitscb of @makesnaps
"Be proactive. Define yourself online." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself on creating an online presence
"You can quickly be defined online by one incident or by what others say about you." —@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"Another problem we deal with is 'anonymous trashing' of our customers." —@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"We deal with a surprising amount of 'revenge porn' with our customers." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"Good results help you as much as bad results hurt you." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"Other companies mystify the process and don't really explain what they're doing. They're also very expensive." —@Brandyourself
"We have created a platform that allows our customers to use the process themselves." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"My business partner has difficulty getting a job—he was getting confused for someone else." @PatrickAmbron on starting @Brandyourself
"I went into it knowing that only two sharks were right for me—@robertherjavec & @mcuban." @PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself
"The experience on @ABCSharkTank was amazing." –@PatrickAmbron of @Brandyourself

Thanks for tuning in for today's show on entrepreneurship! Special thanks to my guests @jonnastor of @HTEpodcast & @she_a of @zanadotio!
"I use @Get_Headspace to help with daily meditation. It's needed in the busyness of entrepreneurship." –@she_a of @zanadotio
"Mentoring a new entrepreneur will help a seasoned entrepreneur stay current and fresh." –@she_a of @zanadotio
On being a successful entrepreneur—"Stay educated, read books and blogs, listen to podcasts. Stay in the game." -@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast
"Not one thing I learned while getting my MBA do I use today in my work." –@she_a of @zanadotio
"Joining a startup is an excellent opportunity if you are a recent grad." –@she_a of @zanadotio
"There's things you can't learn in school—you learn it in the trenches." –@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast #Entreprenuership
"I see it as extreme curiosity—how can I make this? How can I make this better?" –@she_a of @zanadotio
"We want to democratize entrepreneurship. There's inequality in race and sexual orientation. There is ageism." –@she_a of @zanadotio
"One of things that led me to @zanadotio was the inequality of men and women in entrepreneurship." –@she_a
"What's different about @zanadotio is that we are able to find a way to help everyone." –@she_a
"We do startups and entrepreneurship differently here in Silicon Valley." –@she_a of @zanadotio
"Enterpreneurs learn best from each other." – @she_a of @zanadotio
"As an entrepreneur, you're going to do a lot of things people around you won't understand. But that's how things get done." -@jonnastor
"Stubbornness to me is confidence." –@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast
"You can be an employee and an entrepreneur. You can be an intrapreneur." —@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast
"You can scale any freelancing work you are doing into a business. People do it all the time." –@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast
"Wayne Gretzky is the highest scoring hockey player in history, but he also has the highest number of failed shots." –@jonnastor @HTEpodcast
"It's the idea of failure, not the failure itself that holds people back." -@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast
"I think a lot of people are afraid of failure—that fear cripples them from stepping out."
"At some point you have to look at what is right for you and building up that confidence." —@jonnastor of @HTEpodcast

"Voting is so important. It's a big way to make change." —@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"We are working to turnout as many cannabis-using voters to the polls." –@Isaac_Dietrich of @MassRoots
"A majority of Americans support the legalization of marijuana." –@KeithMcCarty of @Eaze_Team
"The gender ratio is evening out. We are seeing women have their bachelorette parties at the Cannabis Cup." –@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"For females, it's not the same demographic as for men. It's the stay-at-home soccer mom who wants something discreet." -@Eaze_Team
"We have such as many women actively posting on our platform as the men." –@Isaac_Dietrich of @MassRoots
"@SnoopDogg has been on our cover. He's bold in his music and he's bold in his investments." –@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"Celebrity endorsement is imperative. People look to their Instagrams, etc." –@KeithMcCarty of @Eaze_Team
"We are seeing niche markets even here in Colorado. People are jumping in the market with new ideas." –@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"Our legal counsel is top notch. They are always working w/law enforcement to make sure we don't violate their regulations." @HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"We are looking for companies that have a product that is absolute necessary in the stoner world." —@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"Concentrates have become a whole subset of the marijuana world." —@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"We have been for oppressed for so long, and every group needs its own code—ours is 4/20." –@HIGH_TIMES_Mag
"Our core values are easy, quick, and professional." —@KeithMcCarty on the success of @Eaze_Team

"Automating the supply and demand on our app is the key to delivery service companies." –@KeithMcCarty of @Eaze_Team
